meanings.sent1: She tried to outsit her friend during the game of musical chairs.
meanings.sent2: He managed to outsit his siblings at the dinner table.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to outsit the dog on the comfy couch.
meanings.sent4: The determined student was able to outsit all his classmates during the exam.
meanings.sent5: In a battle of patience, she was able to outsit everyone in the waiting room.

meanings.definition: To remain seated longer than (someone else)
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, she planned to outsit her colleague to show dedication.
meanings.sent2: He would often outsit his friends at the park, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent3: The old man decided to outsit the youngsters on the park bench.
meanings.sent4: She could outsit anyone in the movie theater, always staying till the end.
meanings.sent5: The patient child would outsit his siblings in the car, waiting for their parents.
